item.title: To require the Corps of Engineers to take into account all available hydrologic data in conducting Missouri River basin operations.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Water Resources and Environment.

item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.

summary.text: Requires the Secretary of the Army, acting through the Chief of Engineers, to take into account all available hydrologic data in conducting Missouri River basin operations.

bill.title: A bill to require the Corps of Engineers to take into account all available hydrologic data in conducting Missouri River basin operations.

item.title: A bill to require the Corps of Engineers to take into account all available hydrologic data in conducting Missouri River basin operations.
A bill to require the Corps of Engineers to take into account all available hydrologic data in conducting Missouri River basin operations.

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
